channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [OOZIE-68] Add Hive action
item.description:
Original issue: GH-22

Add support for Hive actions in workflows.

This would be via a new action executor and an extension schema.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
I've rebased the Hive Action to Oozie's trunk.

I've tried using the Hive JARs from Apache, after HIVE-2391, but they are still broken (i'll make this issue dependent on).

Using CDH Hive JARs I can compile code and testcases, but Hive testcases fail because of Hive ShimLoader (a class to enable working with different versions of Hadoop) does not recognize Hadoop versions with more than 2 dots in it (0.20.104.0, 0.20.204.0 don't work). I've opened a JIRA in Hive for this HIVE-2570 (I'll make this issue dependent on it too). If I modify the version of Hadoop Oozie uses to use CDH version of Hadoop (it has 2 dots in its version 0.20.2-cdh3u2), the Hive Action works fine.

The other option is to run the testcases using Hadoop 0.20 pre security (using -Dhadoop20), It works as well.

[cannot submit a RR because it depends on OOZIE-610 which is not committed yet]

v1 patch, works on top of OOZIE-610.

It uses Apache Hive 0.9.0-SNAPSHOTS artifacts (currently it is the only version of Apache Hive publishing artifacts to the Maven repo).

Due to a conflict between Pig 0.9.0 and Hive 0.9.0 dependencies (explained in OOZIE-610) it is not possible to run in the same build Pig and HIve testcases. Because of this, there is a testHive profile to run just the Hive testcases.

I've build/isntalled Oozie and run the examples to verify things work as expected.

rebased to work on top of OOZIE-565+OOZIE-610

cannot upload it to ReviewBoard because OOZIE-610 is not committed

Diff: https://reviews.apache.org/r/2927/diff

Testing
-------

Note that hive testcases are excluded by default and to run the you have to do:

mvn -DtestHive -Dtest=TestHiveActionExecutor,TestHiveMain

This is mentioned in the ENG_Building twiki.

The reason for this is the dependency conflict between pig and hive regarding antlr

Thanks,

Alejandro

Testing

-------

Note that hive testcases are excluded by default and to run the you have to do:

mvn -DtestHive -Dtest=TestHiveActionExecutor,TestHiveMain

This is mentioned in the ENG_Building twiki.

The reason for this is the dependency conflict between pig and hive regarding antlr

Thanks,

Alejandro

On 2011-11-29 10:06:50, Mohammad Islam wrote:

> /trunk/core/src/main/java/org/apache/oozie/action/hadoop/HiveMain.java, line 182

> <https://reviews.apache.org/r/2927/diff/1/?file=59987#file59987line182>

>

> the file name will be oozie-user-hive-default.xml?

Alejandro Abdelnur wrote:

On the HiveMain side is always this name, the HiveActionExecutor copies with this name.

Mohammad Islam wrote:

mentioning a typo of missing "user" in the xml file name.

got it, fixing that.

On 2011-11-29 10:06:50, Mohammad Islam wrote:

> /trunk/core/src/main/java/org/apache/oozie/action/hadoop/HiveMain.java, line 241

> <https://reviews.apache.org/r/2927/diff/1/?file=59987#file59987line241>

>

> is it parameter 'key' or 'value' ? Sounds 'key' or 'var' more appropriate.

Alejandro Abdelnur wrote:

this is the hive action <param> thus it should be param

Mohammad Islam wrote:

Questioning about the text "Parameter value". Will it be "Parameter key" instead?

well, a param is of the form k=v, same as pig, this exception states that the parameter does not have a value.
